title: Vicus Nediensis
description: A Roman vicus, attested by name in inscriptions discovered in the 19th century. Based on the reported findspots of the inscriptions, the vicus seems to have been located in the vicinity of modern Spechbach, located southeast of Heidelberg, Germany.

properties.description: Associated modern location based on OpenStreetMap
properties.title: OSM location of modern Spechbach
